creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamps

inscribed in plate at top: [HERCVLES VNA CVM IOLAO HYDRAM OCCIDIT]
markings: pink stamp on verso, lower left: Lawrason Riggs (Lugt 1756c); black stamp on verso, lower left: Robert Scholtz (Lugt 2241); blue stamp on verso, lower right: Georg Hamminger (Lugt 1159); black stamp at lower center, undefined, possibly Hans von und zu Aufsess (Lugt 2749). Also on verso: loan number for 1941 Baltimore exhibition.
provenance: Lawrason Riggs, Baltimore; Robert Scholtz, Budapest; Georg Hamminger, Regensburg; additional collector, possibly Hans von und zu Aufsess (sale 1913); John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate at upper right: [1545 HSB]
title: Hercules Slaying the Hydra, From the Labors of Hercules
